caption: Loved it. Great food. Nice to start going out again
Great ambiance, shared plates, and an extensive wine list. Highly recommend the Lamb chops. Three small plates and one Entree was the perfect amount of food for 2 people.

With the small plate format you can try a lot. Main dishes seemed pricey for the size, but everything we tried was delicious. Favorites included the okra, octopus and pork belly. The wild boar reminded me of pot roast but I've never had boar before, maybe that's what it's like. A member of our group loved it, though. Cocktails were unusual and very tasty.
Great atmosphere on the rooftop, but my husband and I got sick later that night.
Go to Greek Islands instead. Lacking quality for the price. Dry meat, bland pita and food made me feel sick. Seriously regret wasting my time & money at this place.

The food here was PHENOMENAL and I really wanted to order each and every item on the menu. The rooftop patio is covered so it makes for a great outdoor spot during covid yet also very comfortable temperature with the heat lamps! My favorite was the octopus, perfect flavor cooked over an oak wood flame I believe.  Giving 4 stars simply because the service was quite slow (over 2 hours to have a few small plates and a bottle of wine with a friend) and because we came quite early (6 pm reservation) on a Friday and they were already out of a lot of items. Probably all covid related so would definitely come back!!!
Great food and ambiance. Everyone was kind there.

Taxim is THE place for authentic Greek food. From the owner who flies to Greece on a regular basis to the taste of every dish (we’ve been there enough times to taste pretty much the whole menu), to the indoors and amazing patio, everything is to love about this place. We are now committed to go once a month because it is the only place in the city that truly makes us feel like we are back in Greece. Highly recommend!
Food was super tasty along paired with great service.

I have to say if the great Greek philosophers were to dine here they would have included the mention of Taxim in their works! Amazing food and vibe. I would recommend you to check it out and reread this review once! David and crew run the show like magnificent eleven!!

Authentic, regional Greek cuisine in an upscale but comfortable setting. Best Greek food in Chicago! Order as many dishes as you can to share and take advantage of the all-Greek wine list. Taxim offers the ultimate Greek dining experience in Chicago, not like the Greektown tourist traps.
damn good food
greek food at this location - very good. I've had nothing but pleasant experiences here and plan to keep coming back. This place has a good atmosphere. Food is like a place in Baltimore I loved.
Great food, drink, and atmosphere. Even though it was cold out the rooftop with space heaters was very comfortable.
Gnocchis were absolutely delicious but the wait was horrible  definitely not a good place for big groups. Perfect for a date.
One of my preferred locations for Greek food. the staff was friendly and observant. this place has a cool atmosphere.
Love this place. Amazing food and ambiance

We reserved a table for three and when we arrived, the hostess told us we had only an hour. The food was okay, but not the typical Greek cuisine that I was expecting. I ordered a salad and ended up with a dip and pitas. Where were the Greek olives, the feta cheese, the greens?  I ordered a martini and the glasses do not have stems. Big bummer for me! This would never happen at Greek Islands. Just saying. Plus they didn't have Absolut vodka or Bombay Sapphire gin, my favorite choices for a martini.  The lamb chops were excellent, otherwise, I wouldn't have given it a single star. A 25% gratuity was added to the check, and although this is printed on the check, this is something that should be verbalized to avoid a double tip being added. Luckily, one of the individuals in my party alerted me to remove the 20% tip that I had added, after we were told that our time was up. Four words: I won't go back.
Great rooftop

Really great take out experience. The ground lamb shoulder didn't travel the best but the smoked pork belly was beyond delicious! Price is a littler higher than some of the options around, but quality justifies the cost.
Great spot for quality greek food. Good place to hang and eat some good food. Definitely worth going back to. The bill was reasonable.
Highly recommend the sea bass made in the traditional Greek style.
A fav location for tasty Greek food. I wish there were more places like this around town. I will be back with my relatives.
greek food at this place - yummy. Very savory. Prices are reasonable.
Amazing

Excellent spot for quality greek food. Nice place to think about business. Fast, efficient, and courteous service. Bring your appetite because portions are generous. Feels like a place in Charlotte that I enjoyed visiting.

My fav spot for delicious greek food. came here on a saturday. looking forward to coming back with my relatives. the prices are fair for the quality of food. i see why this place has a lot of great reviews.
It was delicious. Definitely not what I expected but it was a really nice place great atmosphere. Felt very modern.
Wonderful service and amazing kebab. Beautiful rooftop dining. Definitely recommended.

Went here after a recommendation from a fellow vacationer while in Greece. Was told This place has probably the best Greek food in Chicago. The food was good but I was not impressed. I was not blown away. The service was good and the atmosphere was better. We sat on the rooftop and enjoyed a beautiful Chicago summer evening.

Waited an hour and a half for our entree and cancelled after being told kitchen was backed up. Food that did arrive on time was descent. Will not return. Service was kind and did a good job wasn’t their fault.
My top spot for Greek food. Food with real quality ingredients.  Feeling here is similar to a cafe in San Jose I liked.

25% mandatory COVID service fee not mentioned prior to arrival. Not a good experience. Visiting from NYC. Read some great reviews about Taxim online and did some reading of their website. Came by train to Wicker Park from the city. Lackluster welcome by staff. When our menus were placed we found a note saying a ‘mandatory’ tip surcharge of 25% applies (not on their website or told to me when they confirmed my reservation by phone earlier that day). Also a ‘minimum spend’ mentioned on the menu of $45 pp.  We left before ordering and I said to the waitress on the way out I was upset because I didn’t want to be blind-sighted by an imposed charge. I was met with extreme indignation and ‘why didn’t I want people to be paid during the pandemic?’ I am a consumer who is just trying to help businesses by venturing out! We swiftly found a table at ChopShop down the street and gave them our 25% (I’ve been giving extra tip anyway during the pandemic) but the service was much better.

The food was phenomenal as always! This was my third time going there. Was very happy with every dish. Just great! The reason I’m giving 2 stars instead of 5 is because they surprised us with a 24% covid surcharge! What the heck?! It’s not my fault that there’s a pandemic. It is not fair to pass on the loss of business to customers like me who are trying to support businesses like Taxim! I am a business owner too. I didn’t pass the buck to customers who are trying to support me. This practice is unconscionable! Very shady. It left a bad taste in my mouth! Won’t be coming back!
Spent one evening there, the food was good but the quantity in the plates is very small for the price. The rooftop is comfy
Nice
They don't uphold their reservations. Made reservations for the rooftop and after waiting 30 min past our reservation time we left.

Don't count on reservations, we were told that tables are first-come first serve so our reservation was useless.  Seating was too close to maintain 6 feet of distance in certain areas.  Waited 40 min for a table, people who came well after us got seated before us.  Food was decent, prices were high and mandatory 25% charge was added.
Great variety of small plates and delicious wine

The place has some of the best wine in the neighborhood for a decent price and amazing hummus. I really like the veg options on the menu. They could be a bit more flavorful, but I appreciate the effort in meat-dominated Chicago. What will prevent me from coming back is the covid gratuity of 25 percent added automatically without any heads up. Don’t get me wrong, I would tip this amount normally, but what irritates me is that there is no warning. I ordered just drinks and was shocked when the bill came. Again, I know people are hurting, and would’ve tipped something similar anyway, but you gotta let people know in advance or just include it in your menu prices. Also didn’t care for the suggested 45 dollars per person at a tapas restaurant. Your customers are also affected by covid so some mutual understanding would serve us all well. I think this place has a lot of potential but perhaps tone deaf management.

Honestly, the rooftop patio was neat but that was the only thing I had to say I liked about my first experience here. First off, our server had probably come to our table 3 times in the span of two hours of our stay. Not only did he forget that we ordered food ,but when we finally got the food it was not even the right thing. On top of this, we were CHARGED for the order he messed up and brought back to the kitchen without even touching the wrong dish. On top of this the server already gets 25% tip already on the bill regardless of his piss poor service of our table. Any way we finished our dinner and 40 minutes had passed before I decided to just go up to the bar and ask a random server to give us our check since our server was no where to be found. This experience really left a lasting impression on me. That impression of the absolute promise to never return here.
The dark haired women working the front desk was the rudest I have ever experienced at any restaurant. Can’t win them all but the food and drinks were great.
Good food.  Friendly staff. Good service. Had the arni dish. It was alright.

Rooftop is not as nice as it looks in the pictures, it looked a bit run down to me. Decided to bring my wife here for our anniversary which I mentioned while making my reservation but it was never acknowledge. On top of that they charged us a $25 “covid surcharge” for two people, wasn’t even there longer than 45 min. Why was this never mentioned while I made my reservation or when I got there? Very sketchy. I would love to hear back from them to know how they came up with that number and why they’re doing it. Food was good, but save your money and go elsewhere because this place will charge you as if they are an upscale restaurant.
Great roof top dining!!
The meals and service were above my expectations. I surely liked the atmosphere of this restaurant. Superb place to take the family out for dinner.

Delicious, fresh, upscale Greek inspired food. Everything was good. I ordered takeout during covid and I appreciated their earth friendly packaging and care of presentation despite takeout!!  The highlights were the zucchini fritters and their take on taramosalata(whipped fish roe spread). The roe was well balanced with smoked fish and so delicious and decadent. Great for a group dinner, a cute date, or a takeout splurge.

I used to frequently patronize Taxim. I would have business dinners here as well as dine personally. During this pandemic I've made an effort to support my neighborhood restaurants.  Today I ordered the lamb chop dinner medium and they were over cooked (well done ). I called to let them know and was told to get a replacement or refund I'd have to bring them back.  Again I order dinner from them frequently and instead of working with me or offering half off they asked me to come back out so they could see   the lamb chops were over cooked.  They have lost a long standing customer because of  not respecting my right to be safe. Would think during these times they would be a little more flexible with customers especially since this was their error. Bad move to turn customers off when your sales are at 10-30%. If they close they won't be missed
Everything I've tried here was delicious. Great place to have a family style dinner,
First time on Sat eve.   The chef needs to hide the salt shaker.
Great food ... so flavorful!
Tzatziki sauce on 10 million
Food was amazing. Very accommodating to put late arrival. Service could of been more attentive. Overall would visit again.

The menu has plenty of delicious choices and each dish is prepared with both authentic and high quality ingredients. The small dish of octopus and caramelized red onions tastes amazing, definitely a great decision suggested by our host. The ambiance is warm lighting with a strong feeling of being in Greece as the music compliments the decor. Service was above and beyond, glad to have experienced such a wonderful restaurant.

Taxim is a hidden gem in the city. The best Greek food I think there is. The cauliflower is to die for! I love the muscles, octopus, flatbread, and halumi appetizer. The whole fish was great as was the lamb and eggplant dish! I look forward to coming back. Always great service!

Great place for brunch, lunch, or dinner! Been here twice and loved it both times!!! The yogurt dill appetizer is amazing(a must try).  The entrees are also great, I recommend the chicken kebabs. Very knowledgeable staff and great atmosphere! I will definitely be back:)
Nice atmosphere. Great food, the Greek Asia Minor flavors were wonderful.
Amazing food, great atmosphere, 5 star service.
A real feeling authentic cuisine. From lamb shank to the roast boar - the flavor was amazing.

Just amazing place!!!! The most delicious food ever, amazing decoration, polite ppl, just wonderful place! I'm Greek , living in NY,.one of the most good places I've ever been !!!! We will come back for sure!!!!
The half-chicken, the shrimps and the grilled octopus are excellent.

Just had my birthday party here, and it was wonderful! Made a reservation and was seated with 15 people immediately. Very lively atmosphere and cozy at the same time. Wonderful wine selection and each dish I tried was fantastic. Great for date night or big party and plenty of fun places to go afterward nearby!
We'll done, authentic (instead of tourist-oriented)
In my many visits, I’ve probably eaten my way through at least half the menu.  I have yet to be disappointed by a dish.  I’m so glad my friend introduced me to the food at Taxim!
Unique Greek cuisine ... We had lamb chops and duck gyros and both were excellent.
Overall not very impressed with this spot. Cocktails were tasty but fairly one-note. Every dish was pretty bland - some were even downright unpleasant.
(Translated by Google) Many thanks for the quick help and the uncomplicated transport.  (Original) Vielen lieben Dank für die Schnelle Hilfe und den unkomplizierten transport.
This place is small and intimate. Great food. Perfect for date night!
Great place. Don't forget to ask them about"just the tip" if you order the sea bass
I love everything about this place : the authenticity, the service, the food. I’d give you 10/5 if I could.
Each item tasted was better than the last. From start to finish there was not a wrong note struck. Our three fingers enjoyed the experience immensely.

Food was pretty good, but they didn’t do really simple things that you’d expect of a good Greek restaurant - for example, if you are going to use store bought pitas, fine, but at least warm them up? We ordered an appetizer of spreads and the pita was so hard and cold, I didn’t want to even try the spreads. Everything was on the cusp of being good, but just not quite there.
Excellent and authentic Greek food. Far surpasses quality of the food in Greektown. Amazing service - high energy, focused and creative. Highly recommended
Super cool rooftop with amazing food!

Loved the food - octopus,  1/2 chicken and lamb shank were all very good. Service was great too. However, I thought the place was pretty loud and found it difficult to converse. Could have just been the loud table behind us, but the restaurant wasn't even 1/2 occupied.  I would definitely go again.

One of the sneaky gems of Wicker Park. While obviously Greek, this establishment adds a unique modern twist to some of the Greek favorites while doing the Greek staples as well as anyone. Work your way through their dips before ending with the Lamb Youvetsi and the duck gyro. The former is as well done as I've had the dish. The latter is decidedly not Greek in flavor or style, but overwhelmingly unique and filling.
Love this gem.  The rooftop deck is great.   My favorites are the octopus and ground lamb dishes.
Amazing food, place and hospitality! As a greek in chicago i felt that I was closer to home than ever!

Taxim is our go-to place in the hood. Never disappoints. Great Greek wine selection, knowledgeable and friendly staff, and of course tasty stuff.  We always pick lamb chops and half chicken for main with octopus and grape leaf wrapped shrimp as appetizers.

I am Greek and this is the closest place to Greek kitchen.So surprised from the authenticity of the food.We tried some other famous Greek places in Chicago but they were way far from the greatness of Greek kitchen.
Really good rooftop but no washroom. Food was good. Variety of choices for appetizers. Main dish excellent as well. Lamb dish was really flavorful. Full bar and large wine selections.
Authentic, very good
The service was incredibly bizarre.
Lamb chops yo

Rooftop patio is a must! Super relaxed atmosphere with great food and service! Chris, our server, was very knowledgeable and ensured we always had exactly what we wanted. Great place for larger groups as the small plates are perfect for sharing. Main dishes are fantastic as well and easy to share or enjoy selfishly!

Wonderful Small Plates and Entrees filled our tummies but the wine is a highlight of the evening. Enjoy greek beers too upon request as they are not listed on the menu. Pricey but great got a large group.
Great food great atmosphere Rooftop Bar was great
Delicious food. Natural, quality ingredients. Can easily go for anything on the menu. YUM!!!

This is one of the best Greek restaurants I have been to. The dishes are all very well executed and the flavors are reminiscent of being in Greece. We ordered a few small plates and an entre and enjoyed everything. Highlights were the heirloom tomato salad, lamb shank and grilled shrimp. Great patio as well.

We sat on the rooftop and the weather was perfect, making this spot an ideal date night! We started with the Greek salad, which was good, but I would try something else, because it’s pretty simple. We got the octopus, and the kebab and both were delicious. We also got the duck gyro, which was not your traditional gyro, but it was the most delicious thing we had! I definitely recommend!

The food is out of this world amazing. My husband and I were recently in Greece, and this food was ON a point and to say otherwise, is crazy. Service was spotty, another reason why it felt so authentically European 😂😂. Patio is amazing. Overall, would recommend and we will without a doubt be back.
Main entree was cold and server was very rude and smug. Pork was cold with non grilled, "grilled tomatoes". For all the excellent reviews, this was a very negative experience.
We wanted it to be good- we saw the pictures and the high reviews. But we experienced poor service from the waitress, cold food, and less-than-stellar plates.
Service was spotty...  Sat with empty drinks and dirty plates in front of us on our extremely small 2 top table for far too long. The food was really good though.

I just searched “best restaurants in wicker park” and this Greek restaurant came up and I was not disappointed! Every single small plate was DELICIOUS. We also felt that we had stepped into Europe when going in to the restaurant. Definitely will be going back!
Halal Chicken and Lamb Amazing food, great decor and overall great restaurant experience.
Excellent food, everything was delicious! super nice staff and worth the price! Summer in the terrace is just perfect!
Amazing food with great flavor.

We had mezze options and each dish was excellent - especially the pork with honey and apples.  Sadly, there was a very limited non-alcoholic drinks selection. Lovely rooftop setting in the summer (although can be pretty chilly if not sat near a heater).
One of my fav restaurants in Chicago. Really unusual regional Greek food that you won't find anywhere else. Incredible wine list. Beautiful patio.

Went to Taxim mainly for the rooftop. I had no expectations about the food, turned out to be one of the best Greek restaurants I've tried. Every dish was on point (presentation, flavor and temperature). Definitely recommended.
Wonderful atmosphere! Good and delicious food. Amazing location.Great drinks.
Good food and atmosphere.

Horrible service! We waited for 40 minutes to get a menu and another 20 minutes for a cocktail menu. By the time the waitress asked us if we wanted a drink, we had already received some dishes! The food was decent but kind of cold, which I suspect was due to our lazy server. We got the whole fish - it was not filleted - we got asked if we wanted it filleted, which we responded yes, and then it took another 15 minutes to bring it back out. By that time, the fish was lukewarm! We talked to the manager afterwards, and he was mostly unapologetic, blaming the poor service on the amount of people they had come in last minute — it was not that busy and other tables who came after us were served before us. This is not a cheap meal; it was $50+ a person. I would expect a much higher level of service for that price.  Do yourself a favor and don’t waste your time — the servers here will certainly try.

The ambience was great and the food was AWESOME! One thing - we tried to reschedule/cancel bc we didn't think we were going to make the reservation on time. When I called we learned it was $20pp to cancel within 24 hours of the reservation (and we had 11 folks). Luckily we were able to rush and were only 15 minutes late, but we definitely would have planned differently had we known about the fee. So cancel earlier if you need to! Other than that it was a great experience and perfect evening!
This was probably some of the best Greek food that I've had and that's saying a lot since living near Tarpon Springs, FL and having access to that large Greek community.

Every dish we ordered was exceptional! The lamb chops we're quite possibly the best I've ever had.  Service was great, and prices are very reasonable given quality and location. Highly highly recommend!

The lamb chops, service, and atmosphere are great ! It's a great place to celebrate an achievement, have a family dinner, or a date. I just went yesterday for Mother's Day with my girlfriend, and will be returning soon.
Great food. Great atmosphere. Friendly,  great service.

This place is really amazing.  The food was phenomenal, the ambiance perfect, and the service great.  My fiancé and I are going to Greece on our honeymoon so we mentioned it to our waitress and when she came back to the table she brought a written list of recommendations for our trip and discussed each one with us.

Except the guy who is sitting in the cashier, the rest of employees are not polite. Actually I am half Greek but I got very bad hospitality because of my broken English. I don’t want to describe as a discrimination, but it is about to. I feel myself as a second quality customer About meals; I love so much kokorescti, I got it as a burned kokorescti, I can share the photo if anyone need it. My wife tried to kebab youghurtlou, it was very small and burnt Anyway, if you want to go there as a foreigner, be ready to be frustrated
Great greek food. Would recommend
Great spin on Greek food! Really an enjoyable experience. The tapas style is fun but will cost you a pretty penny! Worth it though if you're looking for a nice Greek dinner with a German flare!
From birth, I was told Greeks were evil(because I’m Turkish) but I have to accept that the food here is amazing. I love the octopus and ouzo.
Great food. Very cool crowd.
The food is excellent, especially the Sea Bass, and the ambiance is lovely. Great spot for a date night.
Great food, excellent service and good wine list.
Service was good but the food was average, I ordered the lamb shank, and was dry over cooked and over half of the meat was missing.

We went to Taxim to celebrate a shared family birthday, mine and my stepdaughter's. My wife, my son, and my son-in-law made up the rest of the group. We had a reservation and we were seated promptly. The staff was friendly and attentive, at times overly attentive in my estimation. The appetizers were very tasty, my bowl of soup was fantastic, and the entrees ranged from good to superb. I feel the prices are slightly high - but I don't live in the city, so I may be off-base here. All that being said, I wasn't inclined to give Taxim five stars, nor was my wife when I asked for her input. But 4.5 stars may be more on the mark than 4. If you have a taste for Greek food, Taxim is definitely worth a try.
Great place, friendly service and the pmfood is phenomenal,  really enjoyed the chicken. Will be back soon.
Great food and atmosphere. Helpful staff.

Wonderful food, absolutely horrible service. Our waiter had no knowledge of the menu and made no effort to help us choose our dinner. She did absolutely nothing and made the bus boys do all the work. Very dissapointing service. Will definitely be back but will be sure to choose our next server wisely.
Best Greek food. Even my super picky Greek father said it's the best Greek food he's ever had. Everyone I've brought there has absolutely loved it.
This place has awsome food. I Would definatly come back
Absolutely delicious
Great flavors
Really good greek standards... I come here for lunch at least twice a month... I'd recommended it
"elevated" Greek food - if you want Greek food stick with the classics not this

It was my 1st time trying Greek food and everything was delicious. We had the grape leaf wrapped shrimp, octopus with fennel & red onion, fried cauliflower, spiced ground lamb, wood-grilled lamb chops, duck gyro and the seasonal peppers & we shared everything.  Everyone's favorite including my 10 & 18 year old were the octopus and the fried cauliflower. We sat on the rooftop and the weather and atmosphere was perfect. You are greeted as soon as you come, the server and the other staff were all very attentive. Will definitely go back.
First time eating Greek food. The duck gyro was amazing, as was the flat bread, and cauliflower app. Definitely order several small plates and share!
Great from start to finish and mote
I live in NYC and I went on a trip to Chicago to visit family and my cousin showed me this restaurant. Amazing, very flavorful Greek food. Would love to go again if I'm back in town.
Smokey Grilled octopus is one of our favorite dishes in Chicago. Tried pork belly this time and it was amazing as well.
Menu was taken away and given to another customer as I was deciding. Manager didn’t seem to care and was very rude.
Inventive, fresh Greek cuisine in a beautiful, lively ambiance.
Meh. Kind of blah.
Get the Chicken

Most authentic greek food in Chicago. The ingredients used are hard to understand because they are true greek items, which is awesome! The wine list is also entirely Greek wines and the staff know the list well and can help make recommendations. The octopus and baby okra were so delicious. Would go back immediately!
Phenomenal.
Great service, and everything is so delicious. One of my favorite restaurants.

Fantastic place for breakfast/brunch. Most people don't think of a Greek restaurant for breakfast, and their omission is your gain if you are willing to try something a bit different. It's a quiet Oasis in a neighborhood with 1 hour waits for brunch. It's a different spin on brunch for sure (they still have eggs and French toast etc) but delicious nonetheless. Keep an open mind and you'll be delighted by beakfast at this lovely restaurant.
Great traditional Greek food with a modern interpretation.
I’d say garbage but that would be a compliment.

I would recommend this restaurant! The service and the atmosphere was very good. The waitress was very personable and very efficient. The food (salads, shrimps, octopus, aegean sea bass and the dessert) was really good, fresh and tasty. Price was fair. A really good experience!

I went there only an hour or so after stepping off of a plane. It was around 10 at night and just stopped by because it looked interesting. Food was somewhat pricey and I wasn't really looking for a big meal, so I opted for a few small plate appetizers. The pita and tzatziki were fresh and seemed made in house after I ordered. Olives were great, and the other dish I got was equally as good. The wait staff were pleasant and didn't seem annoyed by serving me and my small plate appetizers. Seemed like an authentic place, as far as the décor and music.
We went here on a quiet Wednesday night. The menu is really interesting and seemed authentic to us. We had many small plates and everything was delicious and fresh. We will definitely be coming back!

Food doesn't taste good. Overpriced for nothing. Ordered Htapodaki de sgara, supposed to be octopus, instead they brought couple pieces of octopus and a lot of fried onions. For the main dish, I ordered Duck gyro, soooo nasty and too much oil

The reception was very nice and accomodating. The food was great, dishs were good, tho the lamb was a little salty. The reason for the low rating however is the time it took to recieve our first order (literally 25 minutes) and the huge gap between the small plates and main dish, I though they forgot about us until I noticed the family next to us complaining too. The second reason was the noise (I was barely able to hear my friend across the table).
Great venue. Cool and chill ambient. Small but choicest wine selection. Love the octopus and pork belly appetizer.
Awesome food staff was right on

We went to Taxim on a Friday night around 8:30pm. The restaurant was about 1/3rd full. The food was pretty good, we had one spread and some small plates. The fried cauliflower was great. However, the service was lacking. Our server was not very attentive and there was a huge time gap between receiving our first two small plates before the remaining two came. Props to the bus boy for keeping out water glasses full.
Amazing food
Amazing food, awesome ambience!
They lost our reservations but made up for with the great service.
This is our neighborhood go-to for date nights, and for out-of-town guests. Always delicious!
Great rooftop and wonderful food and drinks! One of my favorites in Chicago
Good Turkish/Greek selection.
Best Greek restaurant in Wicker Park.
Love the food here and I was super excited to find out they served brunch. Baklava pancakes, y'all!!! What are you waiting for?
Amazing food, great atmosphere on the rooftop patio!

as a greek person i can say this is the best greek food you can get in chicago. lots of vegetarian options and everything was delicious and very authentic! i especially recommend the tzatziki, fakés, prassopita, and turlú. they also have a great greek wine selection which is hard to find!
Delicious! Great service,  amazing food,  good wine,  beautiful rooftop!
Charming gem. Rooftop is a delight,  but the food is the real star. Wood grilled octopus and lamb chops are not to be missed, and vegans have plenty of delicious options too.
In the top two restaurants in all of Chicago. Very easy to be veg and have an incredible meal, but the Lamb main is bonkers.
This is one of the best kept secrets in chicago. Always the best food and service.
Great food!

Beautiful atmosphere. Might come back again. Turned away because my friend and I only wanted to order a quick drink. The host staff told us that we were unable to buy drinks unless we were ordering food; per the owners request. Note to owner, this mentality is making you lose money.

Not your typical Greek restaurant. Very interesting small plates with a similarly interesting wine list. If you're like me and don't know Greek varietals, you need to rely on your waiter for recommendations. Our waiter made a couple of excellent recommendations. They have rooftop seating which is really cool. Highly recommended.

Had dinner there on their rooftop patio Saturday night. One of the best meals I've ever had in Chicago. Had the quail. Food was fantastic, service was great. The waiter recommended two wines that were amazing and very different. Eating on the rooftop was the cherry on top. I will be back many times.
Wonderful roof deck!

Service was abysmal. 3 courses were brought to the table with no sign of the waitress. Ended up only being able to order the first drink because she never came back to ask us for another until it was time for the check. Had to ask the bus boy for water multiple times or else we'd have eaten with nothing to drink. Food had some great flavors, but not for the price. Waitress also couldn't give me an accurate list of the whiskeys they had or a good description of the  wine selection. We won't be back. Save your time and money and go to Greek town.
Delicious small plates, excellent drinks.  One of the best places in the city!

I have been to this restaurant at least 20 times in all the years I have been living in Bucktown - and I have no idea why I did not review it sooner. It's for sure one of my fave restaurants in the city - and it is good EVERY -SINGLE - TIME.  The food is all fresh, home made completely from scratch even the breads, and the flavors are insanely good. The rooftop is awesome, feels like vacation. I can not say enough good things.  The prices are pretty reasonable too.
Amazing food
Really good food.  Decent service.  Went all small plates for dinner.  Fried Mussels & Offal were good.  Squash fritters and pork belly were excellent.
Not good.
Amazing food and great atmosphere, definitely recommend for a date night or if you just want a great meal. Great staff as well!
They have homemade yogurt, but the meat tends to be dry
Overdone Greek food that you can find at other local places with less frills.

I really enjoyed my meal of Greek tapas tonight and even took some fritters home with me because two of the three tapas was so incredible and filling it was hard for me to finish my third! The decor here is warm and inviting and there is plenty of cozy seating if you want to sit against pillows and just relax. I would suggest coming here with a good friend and splitting all the tapas between the two of you so you can sample all the rich flavors. The food I ordered was fresh, authentic and healthy so this is not your "generic" Greek/American cuisine this is more traditional Greek food with full bodied flavors. I also really enjoyed the hot chai at the end of my meal and next time I will come here just to try some of their desserts.
Uniformly delicious. The tongue is sumptuous.
Great food and ambience. I love that they have small plates and entrées options. Also a good option for Vegetarians. Try the lamb chops, Kritis flat bread, and roasted cauliflower.
One word. Phenomenal!  Excellent food!  Don't believe the 2 Star review, I'm sure that person only likes hot dogs.
Food is great, never a Miss. I didn't know that they had a roof top but great little space for good weather.

We went here on a Tuesday night for our anniversary and the food/service was fantastic. We sat  outside on the patio where the ambiance was great. The cocktails, food, wine, and Greek music all made us feel like we were back on our honeymoon. Except the food here might have even been better than most of the places we went there. Will definitely be back to this new favorite spot.

The fried eggplant and tzatziki appetizers where fantastic. I had the duck gyro and my wife had the vegetarian entree, both where very good. Their where a couple of issues where that we ordered a second eggplant appetizer and it never came, then after our appetizers coming right out it took a really long time for our main dishes to come out, finally the eggplant appetizer that never came was on our bill and it took a while to come out. This is just an issue of an overworked or disorganized staff, there was nothing wrong with the food at all.  We ate on the rooftop patio which was really nice even with the blue line lumbering by every so often.

Nice rooftop, but unbelievably slow and rude service..... Waited 40 min for two dishes, asked server about the status, and she shrugged and said it was on its way...20 minutes later asked again and was told the kitchen hadn't prepared it yet. Asked for the check and left. No explanation from staff... Rooftop is nice though.
expensive, not great
Jason you are an idiot Do NOT EVER compare and say Greek they call it Turkish EVER Obviously you know nothing about history, time for you to learn
The place had a nice ambience, the lamb chop that I had was great. Gf loved the chicken which was juicy and we'll seasoned.
Great dinner, great service, had a fun evening out! Will go back for the delicious food and wine!
Nice new rooftop
Pricey, but well worth it...

Authentic Greek Restaurant in Bucktown, with a more ambient interior than one can find anywhere in Greektown.  I'm especially fond of the variety of fish dishes and sauteed greens on the menu, beyond the usual grilled meats and cheeses (dandelions with lemon, anyone?)  Though I don't see them formally listed on the menu anymore, the marinated olives are delicious and worth requesting as well.
Environment was cool. Food was interesting and tasty, but a little on the expensive side. Great for trying a new place.
Cannot wait to return! So very good.

Greek food but many may call it Turkish.  I loved it either was.  A short walk from the blue line in one of the coolest neighborhoods in Chicago. Service is great along with the wine selection and deserts. Food was outstanding.  Try the beet salad.  I hate beets but ate this dish up.

Contemporary Mediterranean food  with a special greek touch. The service was outstanding and we even got a free beet salad to try as it was our first time there. They have an amazing choice of Greek wines and food is delicious. The only thing I did not like was the pita they served with one of the appetizers. In my opinion, it was too thick and tasted like one of those pre made frozen pita breads instead of home made in the oven. It just seemed to be wrong compared to the rest of the food on our plates which was delicious. Other than that it's a place to go.
Greek wine is tummy mummy bunny mummified nummie

I love this place - it is my favorite place to go to in Chicago.  It has such a homey atmosphere - I love taking friends there to kick back and have long conversations over moscophilero wine while laying against velvety pillows.  The atmosphere is calming during the week - makes me feel like it's my living room.  It's a bit more packed on the weekends because it is a Milwaukee Ave destination hotspot, nonetheless sometimes I sneak a bite late eve before going out.  Every time I go I have to have the okra, hummus and revithia.  -can't wait for the rooftop to open guys, until then a glass plus mezedes and people watching on your patio will definitely suffice!

One of my favorite restaurants in all of Chicago because of its fantastic service,  excellent quality food and great energy! If you're looking for hearty fresh tasting food. ..Taxim is the location! !

My family and I come to Taxim at least once a month. The food is EXCELLENT and the cost is very reasonable! The decor is cozy and warm on a cold winter night, and in the summer, sit outside and enjoy the feel of downtown Chicago. Probably my favorite restaurant in Chicago!
Get the octopus. Do it.
1/2 off wine Monday's! Good Greek food, but by the title I expected more Turkish. A little too expensive.

wow!! hands down the best    and most creative greek food i have ever had the luck to taste. really unique twists on classics like duck gyros and lamb stuffed eggplant with pomegranate reduction sauce. very fresh ingredients with excellent execution, look out greektown.
